Primary Contact: Lorraine Richmond, Director of Culture, Habitat for Humanity Okanagan; Phone: 778.755.4346 ext 207; Email: lorraine.richmond@hfhokanagan.ca
Service Details: - Builds and rehabilitates, simple, decent houses with the help of homeowner (partner) families and donated labour, money and materials- Homes are sold to partner families with no down payment required and are financed with affordable, no-interest mortgages
Eligibility: 1.)  Housing Need:- Must have children under the age of 18 living at home- Current housing is substandard, does not meet their needs, or rent is more than 40% of total gross family income- Must have been resident of Canada and lived in the Central Okanagan for at least two years prior to applying- Program intended for families who have not previously owned a home2.)  Ability to Pay:- Income must meet Low Income Cut-off published by the Provincial Government.- At least one adult member of the family employed full-time and year round- Manageable debts (balance between income & debt)- If family has experienced bankruptcy, must have been discharged for two years3.)  Willingness to partner:- Families agree to complete 500 hours of volunteering with Habitat (Sweat Equity)- Agree to keep home and yard in good condition- Agree to follow all policies of a New Home Ownership Agreement
Address & Map: 1793 Ross RdWest Kelowna, BC     V1Z 3E7View MapQuest Map
Accessibility: Partially Accessible - affiliate offices are not wheelchair accessible
